Jim Webber wrote:
> Hi Bill,
>
>   
>> I disagree on focusing so much on the media types.  What I liked about
>> REST was that the interactions can be predefined and you can snap on
>> media types as needed by specific clients.  Like HTTP conneg handle  
>> the
>> needs of various clients.
>>     
>
> That doesn't sound right to me - you seem to be implying that media  
> types are just ways that consumers might want their information  
> encoded: xml, json, csv, whatever. I think media types define  
> contracts, and so aren't that interchangeable.
>   

Is there any need to make a distinction between resource and 
representation, then?
